<< persistent memory manager functions

varislock

Checks if a variable is locked.

Syntax

state = varislock(scope, variable_name)

Input argument

scope

a string: 'global', 'base', 'caller', 'local'.

variable_name

a string: variable name.

Description

varislock returns true if variable_name has been declared as locked variable and false otherwise.

Example

y = 3;
varislock('local', 'y')
varlock('local', 'y')
varislock('local', 'y')
y = 4
varunlock('local', 'y')
varislock('local', 'y')
y = 4

See also

varlock, varunlock.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
